result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Matthew Mason was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael Matthew Mason is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael Matthew Mason was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DNA surcharge to be collected through DOC  through current probation on 12CF303.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Matthew Mason

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: c: Def, Atty, DA, NRPD & Jail. eif
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Michael Matthew Mason appeared.  Court called at 9:54 a.m.  Set for PTC.  Attorney Andrea recites the agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1 with the domestic abuse enhancer stricken.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1  with the domestic abuse enhancer stricken.. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

Ct. 1 in 15CM620
- DE sentenced to 212 days in the St. Croix County Jail with credit for good time
- Credit for 116 days served
- Court suspends the court costs of $243.00
- Court orders $200 for the DNA surcharge
- DE to pay DNA surcharge through current probation in 12CF303
- 20 days to appeal

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Michael Matthew Mason appeared from jail.  Court called at 9:15 a.m.  Attorney Andrea advises the court the DE has a revocation hearing on Janurary 25, 2016 @ 8:30 a.m.  Continue the PTC after the revocation hearing.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned.  lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Michael Matthew Mason appeared from jail.  Court called at 3:06 p.m.  Attorney Andrea requests a continuance on the PTC.  Court continues the PTC.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned.  lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Notice of Motion to Suppress Statements and Motion to Suppress Evidence. Filed by Atty Andrea. km

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Breana M.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea,   DF:  Michael Matthew Mason appeared from jail. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. ADA Nieskes is requesting $500.00 CB. Defendant is on a PO hold.  Status conference scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
